intro: Macaranga eymae, commonly known as the silver macaranga, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree or shrub that typically grows up to 10 meters in height, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive silver underside. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Macaranga eymae is also notable for its role in supporting local biodiversity and its use in traditional medicine.
